Name: Develop Academic Program
Documentation: The end-to-end process of designing, approving, and preparing academic programs for delivery before any students are enrolled.

Name: Develop Research Capability
Documentation: The strategic process of building and maintaining the institutional environment, infrastructure, and expertise required to conduct world-class research.

Name: Deliver Education & Student Experience
Documentation: The complete student lifecycle, from initial recruitment and admission through to teaching, assessment, graduation, and alumni engagement.

Name: Execute Funded Research
Documentation: The end-to-end process of securing research funding, conducting the research project according to the funder's requirements, and managing its outcomes.

Name: Disseminate Knowledge & Impact
Documentation: The process of translating and sharing research findings, academic knowledge, and institutional expertise with society, industry, and the academic community.

Name: Define Curriculum
Documentation: The stage focused on analyzing needs, designing the structure of programs and courses, and securing the necessary internal academic approvals.

Name: Establish Delivery Resources
Documentation: The stage focused on creating learning materials, assigning faculty, and scheduling the resources required to deliver an approved academic program.

Name: Analyze Market & Academic Needs
Documentation: Assess demand from prospective students, employers, and the academic discipline to identify opportunities for new or revised programs.

Name: Design Course & Program Structure
Documentation: Define learning outcomes, module content, assessment methods, and the overall structure for a new or revised academic program.

Name: Secure Academic Approval
Documentation: Navigate the internal governance process to gain formal approval for the curriculum and program structure from relevant academic bodies.

Name: Develop Learning Materials
Documentation: Create, procure, and assemble all necessary teaching and learning content, such as lecture notes, reading lists, and online resources.

Name: Assign Faculty & Staff
Documentation: Identify and allocate appropriate academic and support staff to teach and administer the program.

Name: Schedule Timetables & Facilities
Documentation: Plan and schedule lectures, seminars, and labs, and book the required physical and virtual facilities.

Name: Define Research Strategy
Documentation: The stage focused on identifying strategic areas of focus and setting institutional goals for research performance and impact.

Name: Build Research Infrastructure
Documentation: The stage focused on acquiring physical assets, recruiting expert personnel, and fostering a culture conducive to high-quality research.

Name: Identify Strategic Research Areas
Documentation: Determine and prioritize the key research fields and themes where the university will focus its investment and efforts.

Name: Set Research Performance Goals
Documentation: Establish key performance indicators and targets for research funding, output quality, and societal impact.

Name: Acquire & Maintain Facilities
Documentation: Procure, manage, and maintain laboratories, specialized equipment, and other physical infrastructure essential for research.

Name: Recruit & Develop Researchers
Documentation: Attract, hire, and support the professional development of leading researchers, faculty, and technical staff.

Name: Foster Research Culture
Documentation: Promote collaboration, interdisciplinary work, and an environment of academic inquiry and integrity.

Name: Recruit & Admit Students
Documentation: The stage covering the marketing of programs, processing of applications, and formal enrollment of new students.

Name: Deliver Teaching & Learning
Documentation: The stage focused on the core educational activities of instruction, assessment, and providing academic support to students.

Name: Manage Student Progression
Documentation: The stage covering the administration of student records, the formal awarding of degrees, and post-graduation engagement.

Name: Market Programs
Documentation: Promote academic programs to prospective students through various channels to attract a strong applicant pool.

Name: Process Applications
Documentation: Receive, evaluate, and make decisions on student applications for admission.

Name: Enroll Students
Documentation: Formally register admitted students, process tuition fees, and onboard them into the university.

Name: Provide Instruction
Documentation: Deliver lectures, tutorials, labs, and other forms of teaching as defined in the curriculum.

Name: Assess Student Performance
Documentation: Conduct examinations, mark assignments, and provide feedback to evaluate student learning and determine grades.

Name: Provide Academic Support
Documentation: Offer academic advice, tutoring, and other support services to help students succeed.

Name: Administer Student Records
Documentation: Maintain accurate and secure records of student enrollment, progression, and academic achievement.

Name: Award Credentials
Documentation: Verify completion of program requirements and formally confer degrees, diplomas, and other qualifications.

Name: Support Alumni Engagement
Documentation: Maintain relationships with graduates to foster a lifelong community and support network.

Name: Secure Research Funding
Documentation: The stage focused on identifying funding sources, preparing compelling proposals, and negotiating the terms of grants and contracts.

Name: Conduct Research Project
Documentation: The stage covering the core execution of the research, from detailed planning and data collection to analysis of findings.

Name: Manage Research Outcomes
Documentation: The stage focused on fulfilling obligations to funders, protecting intellectual property, and ensuring data is properly managed.

Name: Identify Funding Opportunities
Documentation: Proactively search for and identify relevant research grants, contracts, and other funding calls from government, industry, and foundations.

Name: Develop Research Proposal
Documentation: Prepare and write a detailed research proposal outlining the objectives, methodology, budget, and expected impact.

Name: Negotiate Grant/Contract
Documentation: Finalize the terms, conditions, budget, and deliverables of the research funding agreement with the sponsoring organization.

Name: Plan Research Activities
Documentation: Develop a detailed project plan, including timelines, resource allocation, and risk management for the research project.

Name: Execute Research & Collect Data
Documentation: Carry out the planned experiments, surveys, or other research methods and gather the necessary data.

Name: Analyze & Synthesize Findings
Documentation: Process, interpret, and analyze the collected data to draw conclusions and generate new insights.

Name: Report to Funder
Documentation: Prepare and submit progress and final reports to the funding body as required by the grant or contract.

Name: Manage Intellectual Property
Documentation: Identify, protect, and manage inventions, discoveries, and other forms of intellectual property arising from the research.

Name: Archive Research Data
Documentation: Curate, document, and store research data in a secure and accessible repository for future use and verification.

Name: Publish Research
Documentation: The stage focused on preparing research findings for academic scrutiny and dissemination through scholarly channels.

Name: Engage with Community
Documentation: The stage focused on translating and sharing knowledge with non-academic audiences and applying it to real-world problems.

Name: Draft Scholarly Publications
Documentation: Write manuscripts for journal articles, conference papers, and books that describe the research methodology and findings.

Name: Manage Peer Review Process
Documentation: Submit manuscripts to publishers and navigate the peer review process, including responding to reviewer feedback.

Name: Publish & Distribute Findings
Documentation: Make the final, peer-reviewed research output available through publication in academic journals, books, and repositories.

Name: Deliver Public Lectures & Events
Documentation: Organize and present research findings and expert knowledge to the general public and specific interest groups.

Name: Provide Expert Consultancy
Documentation: Offer specialized knowledge and advisory services to industry, government, and non-profit organizations.

Name: Commercialize Innovations
Documentation: Translate research discoveries into practical applications through licensing, spin-out companies, or other commercial pathways.

Name: Academic Program Management
Documentation: The ability to design, develop, approve, and manage the portfolio of academic programs and courses.

Name: Student Lifecycle Management
Documentation: The ability to manage all administrative and support aspects of the student journey from recruitment to alumni relations.

Name: Teaching & Learning Delivery
Documentation: The ability to deliver high-quality instruction, create effective learning environments, and foster student academic development.

Name: Research Management
Documentation: The ability to strategically plan, secure funding for, execute, and ensure compliance of all research activities.

Name: Knowledge & Technology Transfer
Documentation: The ability to disseminate, translate, and commercialize research outputs and institutional knowledge for broader societal and economic impact.

Name: Curriculum Design & Development
Documentation: The ability to create and refine curricula that are academically rigorous, current, and meet the needs of students and society.

Name: Academic Quality Assurance
Documentation: The ability to establish and enforce standards and processes to ensure the quality and integrity of academic programs and awards.

Name: Timetabling & Resource Scheduling
Documentation: The ability to efficiently schedule academic activities and allocate teaching spaces, equipment, and personnel.

Name: Student Recruitment & Admissions
Documentation: The ability to attract, select, and admit qualified students to the university's programs.

Name: Student Records Administration
Documentation: The ability to maintain accurate, secure, and comprehensive records of all students' academic and administrative information.

Name: Student Assessment & Progression
Documentation: The ability to design and administer assessments, track student academic progress, and manage graduation requirements.

Name: Student Support & Wellbeing
Documentation: The ability to provide a range of academic, personal, and professional support services to students.

Name: Instructional Delivery
Documentation: The ability to effectively convey subject matter knowledge and skills to students through various pedagogical methods.

Name: Learning Environment Management
Documentation: The ability to create and manage physical and digital spaces that are conducive to learning and collaboration.

Name: Pedagogical Innovation
Documentation: The ability to explore, develop, and implement new and effective teaching and learning methods and technologies.

Name: Research Strategy & Policy
Documentation: The ability to define strategic research priorities, set performance targets, and establish governing policies for research.

Name: Research Grant & Contract Management
Documentation: The ability to manage the lifecycle of research funding, from proposal submission to financial reporting and compliance.

Name: Research Project Execution
Documentation: The ability to plan, manage, and conduct research projects effectively to achieve their objectives on time and within budget.

Name: Research Ethics & Compliance
Documentation: The ability to ensure all research activities adhere to ethical principles and regulatory requirements.

Name: Intellectual Property Management
Documentation: The ability to identify, protect, and manage the university's intellectual property assets.

Name: Commercialization & Licensing
Documentation: The ability to translate research into commercial products or services through licensing agreements and spin-out companies.

Name: Scholarly Publishing Management
Documentation: The ability to support researchers in publishing their work and manage the university's scholarly communication channels.

Name: Community & Industry Engagement
Documentation: The ability to build and maintain relationships with external partners to facilitate knowledge exchange and collaboration.

Name: Academic Offering
Documentation: Represents the portfolio of educational products, including their structure, content, and learning outcomes.

Name: Person
Documentation: Represents an individual who interacts with the university in a defined role, such as a student or researcher.

Name: Research Work
Documentation: Represents the body of research activity, including proposals, active projects, and the resulting outputs and intellectual property.

Name: Funding
Documentation: Represents financial resources received by the university, such as grants for research or fees for tuition.

Name: Student Record
Documentation: Represents the official administrative and academic record of a student's history and progression at the university.

Name: Program
Documentation: A structured sequence of study, typically leading to a formal qualification.

Name: Course
Documentation: A distinct unit of study within a program, also known as a module or subject.

Name: Curriculum
Documentation: The detailed content, learning objectives, and assessment methods for a program or course.

Name: Student
Documentation: An individual enrolled in a program of study at the university.

Name: Researcher
Documentation: An individual, such as faculty or dedicated staff, who conducts research.

Name: Faculty
Documentation: An academic staff member responsible for teaching and/or research.

Name: Alumnus
Documentation: A former student who has graduated from the university.

Name: Research Project
Documentation: A specific, planned piece of research with defined objectives, timeline, and funding.

Name: Research Proposal
Documentation: A formal document submitted to a funder to request support for a proposed research project.

Name: Research Output
Documentation: A tangible product of research, such as a publication, dataset, or software.

Name: Intellectual Property
Documentation: Creations of the mind, such as inventions, literary and artistic works, and symbols, that have commercial value and are legally protected.

Name: Research Grant
Documentation: A sum of money awarded by a funding body to support a specific research project.

Name: Tuition Fee
Documentation: A fee paid by a student for educational instruction.

Name: Donation
Documentation: A voluntary contribution of funds or resources to the university.

Name: Application
Documentation: A formal request from a prospective student for admission to a program.

Name: Enrollment
Documentation: The official record of a student being registered for a program or course.

Name: Academic Transcript
Documentation: An official record of a student's courses, grades, and credits.

Name: Credential
Documentation: The formal qualification, such as a degree or diploma, awarded upon successful completion of a program.
